All Classes

Class Description
Action
Base class for Actions.
ActionInterface
This interface provides the ability to add methods to Action, without modifying code in the engine, or downcasting references in the game.
Actions
A thin wrapper for java.util.ArrayList<Action> that does not allow nulls to be added.
Actor  
ActorInterface
This interface provides the ability to add methods to Actor, without modifying code in the engine, or downcasting references in the game.
ActorLocations
Represents a bimap of locations and actors.
Allosaur
Child class of CarnivoreInterface A carnivorous dinosaur in the game that eats dinos, corpses and eggs
AllosaurEgg
This class represents the egg laid by an Allosaur Child class of Egg class
Application  
Application  
Application
The main class for the Jurassic World game.
AttackAction
Special Action for attacking other Actors.
Behaviour  
Behaviour  
Brachiosaur
Child class of HerbivoreInterface A herbivourous dinosaur that eats fruits from trees
BrachiosaurEgg
This class represents the egg laid by a Brachiosaur Child class of Egg class
BreedingBehaviour
A class that figures out the distance to a mate and perform the breeding action as well as the layEggAction when dinosaur is pregnant
Bug  
Bush
Bush class that bares and stores fruit as a food source
Capabilities
A collection of Capability objects.
Capable
An interface for representing a collection of any kind of enum.

Enum to represent the different statuses of a dinosaur
Dirt
A class that represents bare dirt.
Display
Class that manages I/O for the system
DoNothingAction
An Action that doesn't do anything.
DropItemAction
Special Action that allows Actors to drop items.
Egg
Abstract class which extends the class PortableItem
Exit
Class that represents a route from one Location to another.
FancyGroundFactory
Class that can create different types of Ground based on the character that represents it.
FeedDinoAction
Special Action which allows player to Feed a dino
Floor  
Floor  
Floor
A class that represents the floor inside a building.
FlyBehaviour  
FollowBehaviour
A class that figures out a MoveAction that will move the actor one step closer to a target Actor or Location.
Fruit
Class representing a Fruit object
Fruit.Status
Enum class which represents the different states that a Fruit can be in
GameMap
Class representing one map within the system.
GameMenu
A class which will contain the game menu which will be shown to the player at the start of the game
Ground
Class representing terrain type
GroundFactory
Interface for factory classes used by GameMap to create new map locations.
GroundInterface
This interface provides the ability to add methods to Ground, without modifying code in the engine, or downcasting references in the game.
Herbivore
Interface extends the DinosaurInterface
HungerBehaviour
LocateFoodBehavior behavior class for handling dinosaur trying to find food based on its unique characteristic (i.e Herbivore or Carnivore)
IntrinsicWeapon
Class that represents a weapon for an unarmed Actor (e.g.
Item
Abstract base class representing a physical object in the game world.
ItemInterface
This interface provides the ability to add methods to Ground, without modifying code in the engine, or downcasting references in the game.

Lake
Lake class that contains Water & Fish Child class of Ground class

Class representing the Player.
Player
Class representing the Player.
PortableItem
Base class for any item that can be picked up and dropped.
Printable
Things that are Printable can appear in the user interface and therefore can be represented by a character in the UI.
Pterodactyl
Child class of CarnivoreInterface A carnivorous dinosaur in the game that eats fish, corpses and eggs and can fly

This class is used to generate Rain in the game

VegMealKit

VendingMachine
